chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Galen Daegmorgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Galen Daegmorgan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Galen Daegmorgan was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count 2

Defendant, Galen Daegmorgan appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. DA Winton - statement regarding resolution and DJOC. Atty Schlough - confirms resolution and gives the Court a waiver of rights questionnaire. Court reviews resolution/DJOC. Court goes over waiver of rights and plea questionnaire with Mr. Daegmorgan. Court finds Mr. Daegmorgan freely and knowingly waives his rights and does not currently suffer from his mental health issues. Court speaks to parties regarding factual basis and goes over maximum penalties. Court finds state has followed procedure re; victim. DE pleas NC to 3rd degree sexual assault. Court accepts plea and  finds deferred acceptance agreement is appropriate and goes over conditions with DE. Court adopts deferred acceptance agreement. Conditions of bail continue. 9:43 am adj'd
Petition to COA is denied.
